required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Neoadjuvant Study of Abemaciclib (LY2835219) in Postmenopausal Women With Hormone Receptor Positive, HER2 Negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: neoMONARCH: A Phase 2 Neoadjuvant Trial Comparing the Biological Effects of 2 Weeks of Abemaciclib (LY2835219) in Combination With Anastrozole to Those of Abemaciclib Monotherapy and Anastrozole Monotherapy and Evaluating the Clinical Activity and Safety of a Subsequent 14 Weeks of Therapy With Abemaciclib in Combination With Anastrozole in Postmenopausal Women With Hormone Receptor Positive, HER2 Negative Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the biological effects of abemaciclib in combination with anastrozole and compare those to the effects of abemaciclib alone and anastrozole alone in the tumors of postmenopausal women with hormone receptor positive (HR+), human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) negative breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline to 2 Weeks in Ki67 Expression
primary_outcome.description: Tumor tissue collected through a core biopsy at baseline and at the end of cycle 1 was used to determine Ki67 expression. Ki67 expression is defined as the percent of cells staining positive by validated central assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Pathologic Complete Response (pCR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment Up to 16 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: pCR is defined as absence of invasive cancer in the breast and sampled regional lymph nodes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR): Clinical Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment to Objective Progression or Start of New Anticancer Therapy (Up to 16 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical objective response is defined as the percentage of participants with the best overall response rate (ORR) with a best OR of CR or PR, according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST) v1.1. ORR is recorded from the start of the study treatment until the earliest of objective progression or start of new anticancer therapy. A responder depends on target and non-target disease and the appearance of new lesions. CR is defined as the disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR is at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. All lymph nodes are non-pathological or normal in size (<10mm short axis). Progressive disease (PD) is a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum on study, a relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of 5 mm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Radiologic Response or Partial Radiological Response: Radiological Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment to Objective Progression or Start of New Anticancer Therapy (Up to 16 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Radiological response is the percentage of participants with CR or, PR according to RECIST v.1.1. A responder is defined as any participant who exhibits a CR or PR. CR is the disappearance of all target lesions. PR is a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. PD is 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum and the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 2 in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondary_outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 v3.0 was a self-administered questionnaire with multidimensional scales that measures 5 functional domains (physical, role, emotional, cognitive, or social functioning), global health status and symptom scales of fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting, dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea, or financial difficulties. A linear transformation is applied to standardize the raw scores to range between 0 and 100 per developer guidelines. For functional domains and global health status, higher scores represent a better level of functioning. For symptoms scales, higher scores represented a greater degree of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle(C)1, Day(D)1: 2 to 4 Hours (Hrs) Postdose; C1D14: 4 Hrs Postdose, 7 Hrs Postdose; C3D1: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose, C4D1 & C5D1, Predose, C5D28: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Abemaciclib apparent clearance (CL/F) was calculated by population nonlinear mixed effects modeling (NONMEM) using all available data spanning cycles 1 and cycles 3-5.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Apparent Volume of Distribution of Abemaciclib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle(C)1, Day(D)1: 2 to 4 Hours (Hrs) Postdose; C1D14: 4 Hrs Postdose, 7 Hrs Postdose; C3D1: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose, C4D1 & C5D1, Predose, C5D28: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Abemaciclib apparent volume of distribution was calculated by population NONMEM using all available data spanning cycles 1 and cycles 3-5.

arm_group.description: Abemaciclib (150 milligrams [mg]) was given orally every 12 hours (Q12H) plus anastrozole (1 mg) orally once daily (QD) for 2 weeks. Loperamide was given as a prophylaxis for 4 weeks and then at physician discretion. All participants received abemaciclib (150 mg) orally Q12H plus anastrozole (1 mg) QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

Abemaciclib (150 mg) was given orally Q12H for 2 weeks. Loperamide was given as a prophylaxis for 4 weeks and then at physician discretion. All participants received abemaciclib (150 mg) orally Q12H plus anastrozole (1 mg) QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

Anastrozole (1 mg) is given orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received abemaciclib (150 mg) orally Q12H plus anastrozole (1 mg) QD for an additional 14 weeks. Loperamide was given as a prophylaxis for the first 2 weeks of the combination treatment and then at physician discretion. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have postmenopausal status.
- Adenocarcinoma of the breast.
- Breast tumor â‰¥1 centimeter (cm) in diameter, HR+, HER2-.
- Neoadjuvant endocrine monotherapy is deemed to be a suitable therapy.
- Primary breast cancer that is suitable for baseline core biopsy.
- Have adequate organ function.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bilateral invasive breast cancer.
- Metastatic breast cancer (local spread to axillary lymph nodes is permitted).
- Inflammatory breast cancer.
- Prior systemic therapy or radiotherapy for invasive or non-invasive breast cancer in the same breast as currently being treated.
- Prior radiotherapy to the ipsilateral chest wall for any malignancy.
- Prior anti-estrogen therapy.

link.description: Click here for more information about this study: A Neoadjuvant Study of Abemaciclib (LY2835219) in Postmenopausal Women With Hormone Receptor Positive, HER2 Negative Breast Cancer

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and European Union (EU), whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants who had progressive disease at the end of the study but off study drug were considered to have completed the study. Participants were randomized to anastrozole, or abemaciclib, and abemaciclib + anastrozole in cycle 1. All participants received abemaciclib + anastrozole post cycle 1.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 milligram (mg) of abemaciclib orally every 12 hours (Q12H) plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally once daily (QD) for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib
group.description: Participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole
group.description: Participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

milestone.title: Received at Least One Dose of Study Drug

participants_list.participants: 1 participant did not receive drug due to an error in randomization.
All 217 participants were assigned to abemaciclib + anastrozole post cycle 1.
All 217 participants were assigned abemaciclib + anastrozole post cycle 1.
All 217 participants were assigned abemaciclib + anastrozole post cycle 1.

milestone.title: Received at Least One Dose of Study Drug

participants_list.participants: All participants who did not discontinue continued to the extension period.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib
group.description: Participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole
group.description: Participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status

category.title: 1 (Restricted, able to do light sedentary work)

measure.title: Ki67 at Baseline
measure.description: Tumor tissue collected through a core biopsy at baseline and at the end of cycle 1 was used to determine Ki67 expression. Ki67 expression is defined as the percent of cells staining positive by validated central assay.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline to 2 Weeks in Ki67 Expression
outcome.description: Tumor tissue collected through a core biopsy at baseline and at the end of cycle 1 was used to determine Ki67 expression. Ki67 expression is defined as the percent of cells staining positive by validated central assay.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and a valid baseline Ki67 measurement of at least 5% and a valid 2-week measurement of any magnitude.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib
group.description: Participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole
group.description: Participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline to 2 Weeks in Ki67 Expression
measure.description: Tumor tissue collected through a core biopsy at baseline and at the end of cycle 1 was used to determine Ki67 expression. Ki67 expression is defined as the percent of cells staining positive by validated central assay.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and a valid baseline Ki67 measurement of at least 5% and a valid 2-week measurement of any magnitude.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Pathologic Complete Response (pCR)
outcome.description: pCR is defined as absence of invasive cancer in the breast and sampled regional lymph nodes.
outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment Up to 16 Weeks
outcome.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1 and had evaluable pCR data. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Pathologic Complete Response (pCR)
measure.description: pCR is defined as absence of invasive cancer in the breast and sampled regional lymph nodes.
measure.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1 and had evaluable pCR data. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR): Clinical Objective Response
outcome.description: Clinical objective response is defined as the percentage of participants with the best overall response rate (ORR) with a best OR of CR or PR, according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST) v1.1. ORR is recorded from the start of the study treatment until the earliest of objective progression or start of new anticancer therapy. A responder depends on target and non-target disease and the appearance of new lesions. CR is defined as the disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR is at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. All lymph nodes are non-pathological or normal in size (<10mm short axis). Progressive disease (PD) is a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum on study, a relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of 5 mm.
outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment to Objective Progression or Start of New Anticancer Therapy (Up to 16 Weeks)
outcome.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR): Clinical Objective Response
measure.description: Clinical objective response is defined as the percentage of participants with the best overall response rate (ORR) with a best OR of CR or PR, according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST) v1.1. ORR is recorded from the start of the study treatment until the earliest of objective progression or start of new anticancer therapy. A responder depends on target and non-target disease and the appearance of new lesions. CR is defined as the disappearance of all non-target lesions. PR is at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. All lymph nodes are non-pathological or normal in size (<10mm short axis). Progressive disease (PD) is a 20% increase in the sum of the diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the smallest sum on study, a relative increase of 20%, the sum must also demonstrate an absolute increase of 5 mm.
measure.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Radiologic Response or Partial Radiological Response: Radiological Response
outcome.description: Radiological response is the percentage of participants with CR or, PR according to RECIST v.1.1. A responder is defined as any participant who exhibits a CR or PR. CR is the disappearance of all target lesions. PR is a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. PD is 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum and the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: From Start of Treatment to Objective Progression or Start of New Anticancer Therapy (Up to 16 Weeks)
outcome.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Radiologic Response or Partial Radiological Response: Radiological Response
measure.description: Radiological response is the percentage of participants with CR or, PR according to RECIST v.1.1. A responder is defined as any participant who exhibits a CR or PR. CR is the disappearance of all target lesions. PR is a 30% decrease in the sum of diameter of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. PD is 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions taking as reference the smallest sum and the appearance of 1 or more new lesions.
measure.population: All participants who received combination treatment post cycle 1. Radiological/surgery assessments occurred at the start of treatment and at the end of the treatment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 2 in European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire-Core 30 (EORTC QLQ-C30)
outcome.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 v3.0 was a self-administered questionnaire with multidimensional scales that measures 5 functional domains (physical, role, emotional, cognitive, or social functioning), global health status and symptom scales of fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting, dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea, or financial difficulties. A linear transformation is applied to standardize the raw scores to range between 0 and 100 per developer guidelines. For functional domains and global health status, higher scores represent a better level of functioning. For symptoms scales, higher scores represented a greater degree of symptoms.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had evaluable data for EORTC QLQ.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib
group.description: Participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole
group.description: Participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

measure.description: EORTC QLQ-C30 v3.0 was a self-administered questionnaire with multidimensional scales that measures 5 functional domains (physical, role, emotional, cognitive, or social functioning), global health status and symptom scales of fatigue, pain, nausea/vomiting, dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea, or financial difficulties. A linear transformation is applied to standardize the raw scores to range between 0 and 100 per developer guidelines. For functional domains and global health status, higher scores represent a better level of functioning. For symptoms scales, higher scores represented a greater degree of symptoms.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug and had evaluable data for EORTC QLQ.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Apparent Clearance of Abemaciclib
outcome.description: Abemaciclib apparent clearance (CL/F) was calculated by population nonlinear mixed effects modeling (NONMEM) using all available data spanning cycles 1 and cycles 3-5.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle(C)1, Day(D)1: 2 to 4 Hours (Hrs) Postdose; C1D14: 4 Hrs Postdose, 7 Hrs Postdose; C3D1: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose, C4D1 & C5D1, Predose, C5D28: Predose, 3 Hrs Postdose
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of abemaciclib across cycles 1 and cycles 3-5. The results are summarized by the original randomized arms of cycle 1.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib
group.description: Cycle 1 participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks (post cycle 1). Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole
group.description: Cycle 1 participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks (post cycle 1). Abemaciclib PK samples were collected during cycles 3-5. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks. The data presented in this cohort is for abemaciclib PK following cycles 3-5.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Apparent Clearance of Abemaciclib
measure.description: Abemaciclib apparent clearance (CL/F) was calculated by population nonlinear mixed effects modeling (NONMEM) using all available data spanning cycles 1 and cycles 3-5.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of abemaciclib across cycles 1 and cycles 3-5. The results are summarized by the original randomized arms of cycle 1.

outcome.title: PK: Apparent Volume of Distribution of Abemaciclib
outcome.description: Abemaciclib apparent volume of distribution was calculated by population NONMEM using all available data spanning cycles 1 and cycles 3-5.

reported_events.desc: All randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole Cycle 1
group.description: Participants were given 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Abemaciclib Cycle 1
group.description: Participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally QD for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

group.title: Anastrozole Cycle 1
group.description: Participants received 1 mg of anastrozole orally Q12H for 2 weeks. All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks. .

group.title: Abemaciclib + Anastrozole Cycle 2 and Beyond
group.description: Combination Therapy: All participants received 150 mg of abemaciclib orally Q12H plus 1 mg of anastrozole orally QD for an additional 14 weeks. Total treatment duration was 16 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
